name: JHS Community (Jericho Health Share)
statementOfFaith: Members affirm a belief in the fundamental and religious right to worship God in their own way and commitment to a caring community. No specific Christian doctrine required.

plans.name: Distinct
plans.coShare: 50% of next $10,000 after MRA (AMRA caps: $5,000 member, $10,000 couple, $15,000 family)

plans.name: Diverse
plans.coShare: 20% of next $10,000 after MRA (AMRA caps: $2,000 member, $4,000 couple, $6,000 family)

plans.name: Dynamic
plans.coShare: 0% after MRA (no AMRA -- 100% shared after MRA)

preExisting.sharingLimits: 24-month lookback period. Pre-existing conditions not shareable for first 12 months (excludes office visits and urgent care). Phased sharing applies after waiting period.

bestFor: Healthy individuals seeking the lowest possible monthly cost with catastrophic-level protection and high deductible tolerance
pros: Among the lowest monthly contributions in the health sharing industry
No strict faith requirement -- open to all beliefs
Access to First Health/PHCS network with 1M+ providers (no reduction for out-of-network)
Can be combined with HSA via MEC plan for tax-free savings
Includes MDLIVE telehealth and Drexi prescription drug benefits
cons: Not available in 17 states (AK, CA, CT, DC, HI, KY, MA, MD, MN, MT, ND, NH, NM, OR, PA, WA, WI)
BBB complaints and government enforcement actions (NH, ND settlements) raise concerns
Maternity only on Diverse ($8,000 cap) and Dynamic ($12,000 cap) with 9-month waiting period
aiSummary: JHS Community, also known as Jericho Health Share, is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit health care sharing ministry based in Houston, TX, offering catastrophic-focused health sharing at some of the lowest monthly costs in the industry. The DIVINE product line includes three tiers: Distinct (most affordable, $250K/year cap, 50% co-share after MRA), Diverse (balanced, $750K/year cap, 20% co-share), and Dynamic (most comprehensive, $1M/year cap, 0% co-share). Members choose a Member Responsibility Amount (MRA) of $2,500, $5,000, or $10,000. The plans include MDLIVE telehealth, Drexi prescription discounts, and access to the First Health/PHCS network with over 1 million providers. Notable limitations include no mental health sharing, limited maternity coverage (Diverse/Dynamic only with 9-month wait), a 12-month pre-existing conditions waiting period, and unavailability in 17 states. The organization has faced regulatory scrutiny, including settlements with New Hampshire and North Dakota attorneys general.
aiKeyFacts: Plans: Distinct ($250K cap), Diverse ($750K cap), Dynamic ($1M cap)
Includes: MDLIVE telehealth, Drexi Rx discounts, wellness services ($500-$2,000/year)
Office visits: $40 copay, up to $400 shared (4/8/12 visits by tier)
Not available in 17 states including CA, MA, PA, WA
Maternity: Diverse up to $8K, Dynamic up to $12K (9-month wait); not on Distinct
